v.v: “Listen before me in silence, you coastlands; let the nations renew their strength;
Who has stirred up one from the east, calling him in righteousness to his service?
He pursues them and passes by safely, by a swift path that his feet scarcely touch.
Who has performed and accomplished these deeds? Who has summoned the generations from the beginning?
The isles have seen and are afraid; the ends of the earth tremble;
Everyone helps his neighbor, and every one says to one another, ‘Be encouraged.’
So the carpenter encourages the goldsmith, and he who works with the hammer encourages him who works with an anvil,
But you, Israel, my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen,
you whom I am bringing back from the ends of the earth, and whom I called from the far away places,
Do not fear, for I am with you. Do not be anxious, for I am your God.
See, they will be ashamed and disgraced, all who have been angry with you;
You will seek and will not find those who contended with you;
For I, Yahweh your God, will hold your right hand,
Do not fear, Jacob you worm, and you men of Israel;
Look, I am making you like a sharp threshing sledge, new and two-edged;
You will winnow them, and the wind will carry them away; the wind will scatter them.
The oppressed and needy look for water, but there is none, and their tongues are parched for thirst;
I will make streams to flow down the slopes, and springs in the middle of the valleys;
In the wilderness I will set the cedar, the acacia, and the myrtle, and the olive tree.
I will do this so that the people may see, recognize, and understand together,
“Present your case,” says Yahweh,
Let them bring us their own arguments; have them come forward and declare to us what will happen,
Tell things about the future, that we may know if you are gods;
See, you idols are nothing and your deeds are nothing; the one who chooses you is detestable.
I have raised up one from the north, and he comes; from the sun’s rising I summon him who calls on my name,
Who announced this from the beginning, that we might know? Before this time, that we may say, “He is right”?
I first said to Zion, “Look here they are;” I sent a herald to Jerusalem.
When I look, there is no one, not one among them who can give good advice,
Look, all of them are nothing,

v: let them come near and speak; let us come near together to argue a dispute.
He hands nations over to him and helps him subdue kings.
He turns them to dust with his sword, like windblown stubble with his bow.
I, Yahweh, the first, and with the last ones, I am he.
they approach and come.
saying of the welding, ‘It is good.’ They fasten it with nails so it will not topple over.
the offspring of Abraham my friend,
and to whom I said, ‘You are my servant;’ I have chosen you and not rejected you.
I will strengthen you, and I will help you, and I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
they will be as nothing and will perish, those who oppose you.
those who warred against you will be like nothing, absolutely nothing.
saying to you, ‘Do not fear; I am helping you.’
I will help you—this is Yahweh’s declaration, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
you will thresh the mountains and crush them; you will make the hills like chaff.
You will rejoice in Yahweh, you will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
I, Yahweh, will respond to their prayers; I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
I will make the desert into a pool of water, and the dry land into springs of water.
I will set the cypress in the desert plain, with the pines and the cypress box trees.
that the hand of Yahweh has done this, that the Holy One of Israel has created it.
“present your best arguments for your idols,” says the King of Jacob.
so we may know these things well.
Have them tell us of earlier predictive declarations, so we can reflect on them and know how they were fulfilled.
do something good or evil, that we may be frightened and impressed.
and he will trample the rulers like mud, like a potter who is treading on the clay.
Indeed none of them decreed it, yes, none heard you say anything.
who, when I ask, can answer a word.
and their deeds are nothing; their cast metal figures are wind and emptiness.
